div.head: Tablature Notation
div.p: This chapter describes the attribute classes that are part of the MEI.tablature module.

div.head: Overview of the Tablature Module
div.p: The tablature module is used to record tablature notation. It may be used to record many different types of tablature (keyboard, organ, lute, guitar, and others.)

The lines attribute on the staffDef element is used to define the number of lines, or strings, present in the tablature. The tab.strings attribute is then used to enumerate the pitches of the open string.
For standard guitar tuning, the staffDef element might look like this:

staffDef.tab.strings: e2 a2 d3 g3 b3 e4

div.p: Some instruments, like the 12-string guitar, have the four lowest strings tuned an octave above but are still written on a 6-line tablature staff. In this case, you may enumerate the open string pitches while maintaining 6 lines.

staffDef.tab.strings: e3 e2 a3 a2 d4 d3 g4 g2 b3 b3 e4 e4

div.p: In the case of keyboard tablature, the tab.strings attribute may be omitted, and the lines attribute used to supply the number of lines on the staff.

The note element is then used to capture the specific events in the tablature. The tab.string attribute is used to capture which string the note is to be played on. (Strings are numbered with the highest open string as number 1). This attribute takes a positive integer in the range of 1-9.
In the case of fretted instruments, you may also capture the fret number with the tab.fret attribute. You may also capture the open string with an "o" value.
